s0001: Laozi was a man of Qu Ren Village, Li Township, Ku County, Chu, surname Li, name Er, courtesy name Dan, Zhou's keeper of the archives.
s0002: Confucius went to Zhou, about to ask about rites from Laozi.
s0003: Laozi said: 'What you speak of, their persons and bones have all rotted away, only their words remain.
s0004: Moreover gentlemen getting their time then drive, not getting their time then roll along like tumbleweed.
s0005: I have heard that good merchants deeply hide as if empty, gentlemen of great virtue appear foolish in countenance.
s0006: Rid yourself of arrogant airs and many desires, affected expressions and licentious ambitions, these are all of no benefit to your person.
s0007: What I tell you is only this.'
s0008: Confucius left, told his disciples: 'Birds, I know they can fly;
s0009: fish, I know they can swim;
s0010: beasts, I know they can run.
s0011: Runners can be netted, swimmers can be lined, flyers can be arrowed.
s0012: As for dragons, I cannot know how they ride wind and clouds up to heaven.
s0013: I today saw Laozi, it was like a dragon!'
s0015: Laozi cultivated morality and virtue, his learning took self-concealment and namelessness as its purpose.
s0016: Stayed in Zhou for a long time, seeing Zhou's decline, then departed.
s0017: Arrived at the pass, the pass commander Yin Xi said: 'You will hide yourself, force yourself to write a book for me.'
s0018: Thus Laozi wrote a book in upper and lower chapters, speaking of the meaning of morality and virtue in over five thousand words and departed, none know where he ended.
s0019: Some say: Lao Lai Zi was also a Chu man, wrote fifteen chapters, speaking of Daoist applications, contemporary with Confucius.
s0020: Laozi was over one hundred sixty years old, some say over two hundred years, because he cultivated the Dao and nurtured longevity.
s0021: After Confucius died 129 years, and the records say Zhou Grand Historian Tan saw Qin Lord Xian saying: 'Originally Qin and Zhou united, united five hundred years and separated, separated seventy years and a hegemon-king will emerge.'
s0022: Some say Tan was Laozi, some say not, the world does not know if it was so or not.
s0024: Laozi's son named Zong, Zong was Wei general, enfeoffed at Duan Gan.
s0025: Zong's son Zhu, Zhu's son Gong, Gong's great-grandson Jia, Jia served Han Xiaowen Emperor.
s0026: Jia's son Xie was Jiaoxi King Ang's tutor, thus established household in Qi.
s0027: Those in the world who study Laozi then belittle Confucian learning, Confucian learning also belittles Laozi.
s0028: 'Ways different do not plan for each other', is this what is meant?
s0029: Li Er non-action self-transforms, pure quiet self-corrects.
s0030: Zhuangzi was a Meng man, named Zhou.
s0031: Zhou once was Meng lacquer garden official, contemporary with Liang Hui King and Qi Xuan King.
